meanings.definition: In a manner relating to or using digraphs.
meanings.sent1: She explained the concept digraphically to her students.
meanings.sent2: The students were asked to write digraphically in their notebooks.
meanings.sent3: The robot tried to speak digraphically, but it kept mixing up the sounds.
meanings.sent4: Her mind worked digraphically, combining ideas seamlessly.
meanings.sent5: The colors on the screen blended digraphically, creating a beautiful image.

meanings.sent1: The digraphically written words were easy to decode.
meanings.sent2: The book had a digraphically illustrated cover.
meanings.sent3: The puzzle was digraphically challenging, with letters paired together.
meanings.sent4: Her speech was digraphically rich, full of combined sounds.
meanings.sent5: The language was digraphically complex, requiring careful analysis.
